questions.question: What is phishing?
answers: It's a new trendy catch-phrase to say fishing!

It's is a type of online scam where hackers impersonate legitimate organizations via email, 
text message, advertisement or other means in order to steal sensitive information.
It's a novel way hackers steal sensitive information via email, text message, advertisement, or other means.
questions.correct_answer_response: You got it! Be on the lookout for suspicious emails, text messages, etc.
questions.incorrect_answer_response: No that's not it. Read below.

questions.question:
You notice you have an email titled, "Unusual Microsoft activity detected". 
The email has just one blue link titled "Check recent activity". What do you do?
answers: You click on the link. After all, whats the worst that can happen, right?
questions.correct_answer_response: You got it! This is a very crude attempt at phishing really. This was an easy one mind you!
questions.incorrect_answer_response: No no! An empty email with just a blue link is a HUGE red flag. Just delete it!

questions.question:
You get an urgent email from IT asking for your password for an emergency, otherwise you 
will get locked out in the next 5 minutes. What do you do?
answers: You respond with your password! It is from IT after all, right?
You delete the email. You should never share your password for any circumstances!
You contact IT and share your password verbally.
questions.correct_answer_response: That's correct! You should under no circumstances share your password with anyone.
questions.incorrect_answer_response:
Nope. You should never ever share your password. Phishing emails are 
designed with a sense of false urgency. Please stop and think first.

questions.question:
You get an email from your boss with an attachment "critical_business_plan.exe". There 
are instructions in the body of the email to run it as soon as possible. What do you do?
answers: Its from your boss!! You must run it as soon as possible! Your job may be on the line.

You verify that the email was from your boss by checking the from address carefully. You then 
contact your boss and ask if he sent the email and inform him that his email account 
may have been compromised.
questions.correct_answer_response:
That's correct! You should never open an executable file sent over email 
even if its from your boss. His email account may have been compromised.
questions.incorrect_answer_response:
Opps. You opened the link and boom, now you have a malware installed in 
your computer. Never open executables attached in an email.
